sen.j: 松平 定猷（まつだいら さだみち、天保5年5月28日 (旧暦)（1834年7月4日） - 安政6年8月22日 (旧暦)（1859年9月18日））は、江戸時代末期の大名。
sen.e: Sadamichi MATSUDAIRA (July 4, 1834- September 18, 1859) was a Daimyo (feudal lord) during the end of the Edo Period.
Sadamichi MATSUDAIRA (July 4, 1834 - September 18, 1859) was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) during the end of the Edo Period.
Sadamichi MATSUDAIRA (July 4, 1834 - September 18, 1859) was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) during the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 伊勢国桑名藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Third Hanshu (Domain lord) of the Ise Province, Kuwana Domain.
The third lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.
The third lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.

sen.j: 定綱系久松松平家12代。
sen.e: Twelfth head of the Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.
The twelfth head of the Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.
The twelfth head of the Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.

sen.j: 第2代藩主・松平定和の長男。
sen.e: First son of the second Hanshu, Sadakazu MATSUDAIRA.
He was the first son of the second lord, Sadakazu MATSUDAIRA.
He was the first son of the second lord, Sadakazu MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 母は島津重豪の娘・孝姫。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU, Takahime.
His mother was the daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU, Takahime.
His mother was the daughter of Shigehide SHIMAZU, Takahime.

sen.j: 正室は真田幸良の娘。
sen.e: His legal wife was the daughter of Yukiyoshi SANADA.
His legal wife was the daughter of Yukiyoshi SANADA.
His legal wife was the daughter of Yukiyoshi SANADA.

sen.j: 子に松平定教（長男）、初子（松平定敬正室）。
sen.e: His children were Sadanori MATSUDAIRA (first son) and Hatsuko (legal wife of Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA).
His children were Sadanori MATSUDAIRA (first son) and Hatsuko (legal wife of Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA).
His children were Sadanori MATSUDAIRA (first son) and Hatsuko (legal wife of Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA).

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）5月28日生まれ。
sen.e: He was born on July 4, 1834.
He was born on July 4, 1834.
He was born on July 4, 1834.

sen.j: 通称は和之進。
sen.e: He was called Kazunoshin.
He was commonly known as Kazunoshin.
He was commonly known as Kazunoshin.

sen.j: 名は定猷のほか、定統、猷。
sen.e: His names other than Sadamichi were Sadamune.
His names other than Sadamichi were Sadamune and yu.
His names other than Sadamichi were Sadamune and yu.

sen.j: 官位は従四位下、越中国守、侍従。
sen.e: His court rank and positions were Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Governor of Echu, Jiju (chamberlain).
His court rank and positions were Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), Jiju (chamberlain).
His court rank and positions were Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kuni no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province), Jiju (chamberlain).

sen.j: 天保13年（1842年）、父・定和の死で幼少の身ながら藩主となった。
sen.e: Upon his father, Sadakazu's death in 1842, he became Hanshu although he was young.
Upon his father, Sadakazu's death in 1842, he became the lord of his domain although he was young.
Upon his father, Sadakazu's death in 1842, he became the lord of his domain although he was young.

sen.j: しかし藩主就任の年、桑名の大火と飢饉が発生する。
sen.e: However, the Great Fire and Famine of Kuwana happened the year he became Hanshu.
However, the Great Fire and Famine of Kuwana happened the year he became the lord of domain.
However, the Great Fire and Famine of Kuwana happened the year he became the lord of domain.

sen.j: その後も安政元年（1854年）には安政の大地震が起こるなど、その治世は天災のために多難を極めた。
sen.e: His rule was difficult because of the natural disasters that struck, such as the Great Earthquake of Ansei in 1854.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His rule was difficult because of the natural disasters that struck, such as the Great Earthquake of Ansei in 1854.
His rule was difficult because of the natural disasters that struck, such as the Great Earthquake of Ansei in 1854.

sen.j: 財政は天災に対する救済費、対策費などで火の車となった。
sen.e: Domain finances were tight because of the need to use money for assistance and measures against natural disasters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the Domain was in dire fiscal straits because of the costs for relief and countermeasure programs against natural disasters.
As a result, the Domain was in dire fiscal straits because of the costs for relief and countermeasure programs against natural disasters.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）、徳川家定が第13代将軍になると、同じ「定」の字を避けるため、猷と名乗った。
sen.e: When Iesada TOKUGAWA became the thirteenth Shogun in 1853, he started to called himself Michi to avoid using the same character 'Sada'.
When Iesada TOKUGAWA became the thirteenth Shogun in 1853, he started to call himself Michi to avoid using the same character 'Sada'.
When Iesada TOKUGAWA became the thirteenth Shogun in 1853, he started to call himself Michi to avoid using the same character 'Sada'.

sen.j: 安政6年（1859年）、京都警護を命じられたが、藩内における財政窮乏問題などからの心労で病に倒れ、同年8月21日、または8月22日に26歳の若さで病死した。
sen.e: He was order to guard Kyoto in 1859, but fell ill from stress and work due to the poor finances of his domain and died at the young age of 26 on August 21 (August 22).
He was ordered to guard Kyoto in 1859, but fell ill from stress and work due to the poor finances of his domain and died at the young age of 26 on August 21 (August 22).
He was ordered to guard Kyoto in 1859, but fell ill from stress and work due to the poor finances of his domain and died at the young age of 26 on August 21 (August 22).

sen.j: 死後、長男の定教は幼少で妾腹でもあったため、正室の子である初子に婿養子の松平定敬を迎え、家督を継がせた。
sen.e: After his death the family head was succeeded by his son-in-law, Sadakei MATSUDAIRA, who married his legal wife's child, Hatsuko because his first son, Sadanori's mother was a concubine and was still young.

After his death the family head was succeeded by his son-in-law, Sadakei MATSUDAIRA, who married his legal wife's child, Hatsuko because his first son, Sadanori's mother was a concubine and was still young.

After his death the family head was succeeded by his son-in-law, Sadakei MATSUDAIRA, who married his legal wife's child, Hatsuko because his first son, Sadanori's mother was a concubine and was still young.

sen.j: 法号：英哲院殿寛誉至徳健堂大居士。
sen.e: His hogo (Buddhist name): Eitetsu indenKanyoshitoku Kendo Daikoji
His hogo (Buddhist name): Eitetsu indenKanyoshitoku Kendo Daikoji
His hogo (Buddhist name): Eitetsu indenKanyoshitoku Kendo Daikoji

sen.j: 墓所：東京都江東区白河 (江東区)の霊巌寺 (東京都江東区)。
sen.e: His grave is at Reigan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo.
His grave is at Reigan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo.
His grave is at Reigan-ji Temple in Shirakawa, Koto Ward, Tokyo.
